verses.verse: Behold, <WH3303> you are beautiful, my love. <WH7474> Behold, <WH3303> you are beautiful. Your eyes <WH5869> are doves <WH3123> behind <WH1157> your veil. <WH6777> Your hair <WH8181> is as a flock <WH5739> of goats, <WH5795> that descend <WH1570> from Mount <WH2022> Gilead. <WH1568>

Your teeth <WH8127> are like a newly shorn <WH7094> flock, <WH5739> which have come up <WH5927> from the washing, <WH7367> where every one of them has twins. <WH8382> None is bereaved among them. <WH7909>

Your lips <WH8193> are like scarlet <WH8144> thread. <WH2339> Your mouth <WH4057> is lovely. <WH5000> Your temples <WH7541> are like a piece <WH6400> of a pomegranate <WH7416> behind <WH1157> your veil. <WH6777>

Your neck <WH6677> is like David <WH1732>'s tower <WH4026> built <WH1129> for an armory, <WH8530> whereon a thousand <WH505> shields <WH4043> hang, <WH8518> all the shields <WH7982> of the mighty men. <WH1368>
Your two <WH8147> breasts <WH7699> are like two <WH8147> <WH99999> fawns <WH6646> that are twins <WH8380> of a roe, <WH7462> which feed among the lilies. <WH7799>
Until the day <WH3117> is cool, <WH6315> and the shadows <WH6752> flee away, <WH5127> I will go <WH3212> to the mountain <WH2022> of myrrh, <WH4753> to the hill <WH1389> of frankincense. <WH3828>
You are all beautiful, <WH3303> my love. <WH7474> There is no spot in you. <WH3971>

Come <WH935> with me from Lebanon, <WH3844> my bride, <WH3618> with me from Lebanon. <WH3844> Look <WH7789> from the top <WH7218> of Amana, <WH549> from the top <WH7218> of Senir <WH8149> and Hermon, <WH2768> from the lions <WH738>' dens, <WH4585> from the mountains <WH2042> of the leopards. <WH5246>

You have ravished my heart, <WH3823> my sister, <WH269> my bride. <WH3618> You have ravished my heart <WH3823> with one <WH259> of your eyes, <WH5869> with one <WH259> chain <WH6060> of your neck. <WH6677>

How beautiful <WH3302> is your love, <WH1730> my sister, <WH269> my bride! <WH3618> How much better <WH2895> is your love <WH1730> than wine! <WH3196> The fragrance <WH7381> of your perfumes <WH8081> than all kinds of spices! <WH1314>

Your lips, <WH8193> my bride, <WH3618> drip <WH5197> like the honeycomb. <WH5317> Honey <WH1706> and milk <WH2461> are under your tongue. <WH3956> The smell <WH7381> of your garments <WH8008> is like the smell <WH7381> of Lebanon. <WH3844>
A locked <WH5274> up garden <WH1588> is my sister, <WH269> my bride; <WH3618> a locked up <WH5274> spring, <WH1530> a sealed <WH2856> fountain. <WH4599>
Your shoots <WH7973> are an orchard <WH6508> of pomegranates, <WH7416> with precious <WH4022> fruits: <WH6529> henna <WH3724> with spikenard plants, <WH5373>

spikenard <WH5373> and saffron, <WH3750> calamus <WH7070> and cinnamon, <WH7076> with every kind of incense <WH3828> tree; <WH6086> myrrh <WH4753> and aloes, <WH174> with all the best <WH7218> spices, <WH1314>
a fountain <WH4599> of gardens, <WH1588> a well <WH875> of living <WH2416> waters, <WH4325> flowing streams <WH5140> from Lebanon. <WH3844> Beloved

Awake, <WH5782> north wind; <WH6828> and come, <WH935> you south! <WH8486> Blow <WH6315> on my garden, <WH1588> that its spices <WH1314> may flow out. <WH5140> Let my beloved <WH1730> come <WH935> into his garden, <WH1588> and taste <WH398> his precious <WH4022> fruits. <WH6529>
